>
[Psychopomp Mask](/Equipment.aspx?ID=964)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Strength of Thousands</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #169: Kindled Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=94) pg. 74</row>

**Price** 5 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn mask

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

These minor magic items are painted to resemble your face, or some metaphorical depiction thereof, to encourage the ushers of death to take the mask in your place. If you begin your turn with a [dying](/Conditions.aspx?ID=11) value of 3 or greater, instead of making your recovery check, you lose the dying condition but remain [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) at 0 Hit Points. The mask then cracks in half and is destroyed. The [psychopomps](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=83) won't be so easily fooled again—you are temporarily immune to the effects of any _psychopomp mask_ for 1 year.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
